meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Quarries (Safety) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: anchorage (錨椿) means a fixed object of adequate strength, embedded in firm ground, to which a safety rope can be securely attached; (L.N. 208 of 1973)
approved deputy supervisor (認可副主管) means a person approved as a deputy supervisor of a quarry under regulation 6(1);
approved supervisor (認可主管) means a person approved as a supervisor of a quarry under regulation 4(1);

banksman (工作區指導員) means a person who, for the purpose of preventing any mechanical equipment in a quarry from going over the edge of any face, side, tip or embankment in the quarry, directs and guides the operator or driver of that equipment from the ground;
dangerous occurrence (危險事故) means an occurrence specified in the Schedule to the Factories and Industrial Undertakings Regulations (Cap. 59 sub. leg. A); (E.R. 4 of 2024)
Equipment Register (設備登記冊) means the register required to be kept and maintained in a quarry under regulation 14(1)(a);
mechanical equipment (機動設備) means a bulldozer, dumper, excavator, grader, lorry or shovel loader, or any mobile machine which is used for the handling of any substance in a quarry;

def.name: PersonTrainedInFirstAid
def.leadIn: person trained in first aid (曾受急救訓練的人) means a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds a current certificate of competency in first aid issued by the St. John Ambulance Association; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a registered nurse within the meaning of the Nurses Registration Ordinance (Cap. 164),

def.continued: and, until 1 July 1970, also means a person who holds a certificate of competency in first aid issued by the St. John Ambulance Association at any time after 1 October 1959;

section.def: Quarry Inspection Register (石礦場視察登記冊) means the register required to be kept and maintained in a quarry under regulation 14(1)(b);
safety harness (安全吊帶) includes a safety belt; (L.N. 208 of 1973)

safety rope (安全繩索) means a fibre or nylon rope which, whether consisting of a single length or made up of lengths, has an overall minimum breaking load of 13 kilonewtons force and a minimum circumference of 30 millimetres; (L.N. 208 of 1973; L.N. 238 of 1984)
vehicle (車輛) includes any mechanical equipment; (E.R. 4 of 2024)
work (工作) includes the operation or driving of any mechanical equipment.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Approval of Supervisors and Deputy Supervisors

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application for approval as supervisor

subsection.content: An application for the approval of any person as a supervisor of a quarry shall be made by that person in the prescribed form. (See First Schedule, Form 1)
Every application made under paragraph (1) shall have a full-face photograph of the applicant affixed thereto.

Any application made under paragraph (1) may specify a date, being not more than 3 months later than the date of the application, before which the applicant does not desire the approval to come into effect.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Grounds for approval of supervisor

subsection.leadIn: Where, on an application for the approval of any person as a supervisor of a quarry, the Commissioner for Labour is satisfied that the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not less than 30 years of age;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has had not less than 5 years practical experience in work in quarries; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is competent to be an approved supervisor of the quarry for the purposes of these regulations,

subsection.continued: and that the proprietor consents to the approval of the applicant, the Commissioner for Labour may approve the applicant as a supervisor of the quarry.

subsection.content: Where the Commissioner for Labour approves under paragraph (1) any applicant who has specified under regulation 3(3) a date before which the applicant does not desire such approval to come into effect, such approval shall come into effect on the date so specified.
Subject to paragraph (2), every approval by the Commissioner for Labour under paragraph (1) shall come into effect immediately.

Where, at the time that any approval by the Commissioner for Labour under paragraph (1) comes into effect, the applicant so approved is an approved supervisor or an approved deputy supervisor of any other quarry, the approval of the applicant in respect of such other quarry shall be deemed thereupon to be withdrawn.

Where the approval of any supervisor or deputy supervisor of a quarry is deemed to be withdrawn under paragraph (4), the Commissioner shall forthwith notify the proprietor of such quarry in writing, in English and in Chinese, that such approval has been so withdrawn.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Application for approval as deputy supervisor

subsection.content: An application for the approval of any person as a deputy supervisor of a quarry shall be made by that person in the prescribed form. (See First Schedule, Form 1)
Every application made under paragraph (1) shall have a full-face photograph of the applicant affixed thereto.

Any application made under paragraph (1) may specify a date, being not more than 3 months later than the date of the application, before which the applicant does not desire the approval to come into effect.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Grounds for approval of deputy supervisor

subsection.leadIn: Where, on an application for the approval of any person as a deputy supervisor of a quarry, the Commissioner for Labour is satisfied that the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not less than 25 years of age;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has had not less than 3 years practical experience in work in quarries; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is competent to be an approved deputy supervisor of the quarry for the purposes of these regulations,

subsection.continued: and that the proprietor consents to the approval of the applicant, the Commissioner for Labour may approve the applicant as a deputy supervisor of the quarry.

subsection.content: Where the Commissioner for Labour approves under paragraph (1) any applicant who has specified under regulation 5(3) a date before which the applicant does not desire such approval to come into effect, such approval shall come into effect on the date so specified.
Subject to paragraph (2), every approval by the Commissioner for Labour under paragraph (1) shall come into effect immediately.

Where, at the time that any approval by the Commissioner for Labour under paragraph (1) comes into effect, the applicant so approved is an approved supervisor or an approved deputy supervisor of any other quarry, the approval of the applicant in respect of such other quarry shall be deemed thereupon to be withdrawn.

Where the approval of any supervisor or deputy supervisor of a quarry is deemed to be withdrawn under paragraph (4), the Commissioner shall forthwith notify the proprietor of such quarry in writing, in English and in Chinese, that such approval has been so withdrawn.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Commissioner to serve notice of decision on applicant

subsection.content: Where the Commissioner for Labour approves or refuses to approve any person as a supervisor or deputy supervisor under regulation 4(1) or regulation 6(1), the Commissioner shall forthwith notify that person in writing, in English and in Chinese, of his decision.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commissioner for Labour refuses to approve any person as a supervisor or deputy supervisor, the notice referred to in paragraph (1) shall include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of the reasons of the Commissioner for Labour for his refusal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an endorsement which shall set out the provisions of this regulation and of regulations 11, 12 and 13.

subsection.content: Any person whom the Commissioner for Labour refuses to approve as a supervisor or deputy supervisor under regulation 4(1) or regulation 6(1) may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board. (6 of 1994 s. 37)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Approval to be withdrawn on request

subsection.content: At the request of an approved supervisor or an approved deputy supervisor in a quarry, the Commissioner for Labour shall withdraw his approval of that supervisor or deputy supervisor.

Where the Commissioner for Labour withdraws his approval of any supervisor or deputy supervisor under paragraph (1), the Commissioner shall forthwith notify the proprietor of the quarry in writing, in English and in Chinese, that his approval has been so withdrawn.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Proprietor to give notice of termination of employment of supervisor or deputy supervisor

subsection.leadIn: Where the proprietor of a quarry ceases to employ an approved supervisor or an approved deputy supervisor, the proprietor shall within 14 days thereafter notify the Commissioner for Labour in writing, in English or in Chinese, of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of that supervisor or deputy supervisor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which he ceased to employ that supervisor or deputy supervisor.

subsection.content: Any proprietor who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Grounds on which approval of supervisor or deputy supervisor may be withdrawn

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commissioner for Labour is satisfied that an approved supervisor or an approved deputy supervisor of a quarry—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been convicted of an offence against these regulations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is no longer acting as an approved supervisor or an approved deputy supervisor of the quarry for the purposes of these regulations,

subsection.continued: he may withdraw his approval of that supervisor or deputy supervisor.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commissioner for Labour withdraws his approval of a supervisor or a deputy supervisor under paragraph (1), the Commissioner shall forthwith serve notice in writing, in English and in Chinese, of his decision on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that supervisor or deputy supervisor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proprietor of the quarry.

subsection.leadIn: Every notice referred to in paragraph (2) shall include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of the reasons of the Commissioner for Labour for withdrawing his approval; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an endorsement which shall set out the provisions of this regulation and of regulations 11, 12 and 13.

subsection.content: Any supervisor or deputy supervisor in respect of whom the Commissioner for Labour withdraws his approval under paragraph (1) may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board. (6 of 1994 s. 37)

section.name: s11
section.heading: Time limit for appeal
section.content: Every appeal under regulation 7(3) or regulation 10(4) shall be brought within 28 days of the date of service on the appellant of the notice in writing of the decision of the Commissioner for Labour against which the appeal is brought.

section.name: s11A
section.heading: Operation of decision in case of appeal
section.content: A decision of the Commissioner for Labour against which an appeal is brought under regulation 10(4) shall be suspended in its operation as from the day on which the appeal is made until such appeal is disposed of, withdrawn or abandoned unless such suspension would, in the opinion of the Commissioner for Labour, be contrary to the public interest and the notice of the decision contains a statement to that effect.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Powers of Chief Executive on appeal
section.text: Upon any such appeal the Chief Executive may confirm, reverse or vary the decision of the Commissioner for Labour.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Permission for supervisor or deputy supervisor to continue to act pending appeal

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commissioner for Labour withdraws his approval of a supervisor or deputy supervisor of a quarry under regulation 10(1), the Commissioner for Labour may permit the supervisor or deputy supervisor to continue to be an approved supervisor or an approved deputy supervisor of the quarry on such conditions, if any, as the Commissioner for Labour thinks fit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: until the time specified in regulation 11 for bringing an appeal has expired; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the supervisor or deputy supervisor within the time specified in regulation 11 appeals against the decision of the Commissioner for Labour, until the appeal is disposed of,

subsection.content: Notwithstanding paragraph (1), where the supervisor or deputy supervisor within the time specified in regulation 11 appeals against the decision of the Commissioner for Labour and the appeal is not disposed of within that specified time, the Commissioner for Labour may permit the supervisor or deputy supervisor to continue to be an approved supervisor or an approved deputy supervisor of the quarry on such conditions, if any, as the Commissioner for Labour thinks fit, until the appeal is disposed of.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Registers to be kept in quarry

subsection.leadIn: In every quarry there shall at all times be kept and maintained the following registers—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an Equipment Register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Quarry Inspection Register; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a Time Register.

subsection.content: Every register shall be in the prescribed form and may be maintained either in English or in Chinese. (See First Schedule, Forms 2, 3 and 4)
The proprietor of any quarry in respect of which paragraph (1) or (2) is contravened shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Quarry to be fenced

subsection.content: Every quarry shall be bounded by a five-strand wire fence or by such other type of fence as the Commissioner or any officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for Labour may approve in writing in any particular case.
Every fence shall be not less than 1.2 metres in height above the ground. (L.N 238 of 1984)
The proprietor of any quarry in respect of which paragraph (1) or (2) is contravened shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Warning notices

subsection.content: Every quarry shall have along its boundary fences, at intervals of not more than 15 metres, warning notices in accordance with this regulation. (L.N. 238 of 1984)

subsection.leadIn: Every warning notice shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: face outwards from the quarry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content:
bear in letters and characters of not less than 40 millimetres in height, the following— (L.N. 238 of 1984)“DANGER—QUARRY
危險——石礦場”.

subsection.content: The proprietor of any quarry in respect of which paragraph (1) or (2) is contravened shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Proprietor to provide safety helmets

subsection.content: The proprietor of every quarry shall provide for every person who works on any top, face or floor in the quarry a safety helmet of a type approved by the Commissioner or any officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for Labour.
Any proprietor who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Proprietor to provide safety rope or harness

subsection.content: The proprietor of every quarry shall provide for every person who works on any top or face in the quarry a safety rope and a safety harness of a type approved by the Commissioner or any officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for Labour. (L.N. 208 of 1973)
Any proprietor who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Certain number of workers to be trained in first aid

subsection.leadIn: No work shall be carried on in any quarry unless the following number of the persons working in the quarry are persons trained in first aid—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where less than 50 persons are so working, 3 persons or such lesser number of persons as the Commissioner or any officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for Labour may specify in writing in any particular case;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where 50 or more persons but less than 300 persons are so working, 3 persons; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where 300 or more persons are so working, 5 persons.

subsection.leadIn: Where any work is carried on in a quarry in contravention of paragraph (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proprietor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the supervisor on duty,

subsection.continued: shall each be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Proprietor to deliver to Commissioner for Labour particulars of persons trained in first aid

subsection.content: The proprietor of every quarry in which any person trained in first aid is working at the date of commencement* of this Part shall within 14 days thereafter deliver in writing, in English or in Chinese, to the Commissioner for Labour the information required under paragraph (3) in relation to such person.

The proprietor of every quarry in which any person trained in first aid commences to work after the date of commencement of this Part shall within 14 days of the date on which that person commences to work in the quarry deliver in writing, in English or in Chinese, to the Commissioner for Labour the information required under paragraph (3) in relation to such person.

subsection.leadIn: The information required to be delivered in writing to the Commissioner for Labour in respect of the person trained in first aid shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of such person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which he commenced to work in the quarry; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the qualifications by virtue of which he is deemed to be trained in first aid.

subsection.leadIn: Where after the date of commencement of this Part any person trained in first aid ceases to work in any quarry, the proprietor of the quarry shall within 14 days of such person having ceased to work in the quarry notify the Commissioner for Labour in writing, in English or in Chinese, of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name of such person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which such person ceased to work in the quarry.

subsection.content: Any proprietor who contravenes paragraph (1), (2) or (4) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s21
section.heading: First aid equipment to be kept in quarry

subsection.content: In every quarry there shall at all times be kept and maintained in good condition the first aid equipment specified in the Second Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner or any officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for Labour may by notice in writing, in English and in Chinese, to the proprietor of a quarry require that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a sufficient supply of assorted sizes of waterproof adhesive wound dressings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a sufficient supply of waterproof adhesive plaster,

subsection.continued: shall be kept and maintained in good condition in the quarry.

subsection.leadIn: The proprietor of a quarry in respect of which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: paragraph (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a requirement made under paragraph (2),

subsection.continued: is contravened shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s22
section.heading: First aid equipment to be kept in box or cupboard

subsection.content: All first aid equipment which is required to be kept and maintained in a quarry under regulation 21(1) and (2) shall be kept and maintained in a first aid box or cupboard which is of adequate capacity and which is in a readily accessible place.
Nothing except first aid equipment shall be kept in a first aid box or cupboard.
Every first aid box or cupboard shall be marked plainly “FIRST AID” in English and “ 急救 “ in Chinese.
The proprietor of any quarry in respect of which paragraph (1), (2) or (3) is contravened shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Proprietor to designate person in charge of first aid box or cupboard

subsection.content: The proprietor of every quarry shall designate a person who works in the quarry and who is a person trained in first aid to be in charge of the first aid box or cupboard and the first aid equipment contained therein.
Any proprietor who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Stretcher to be kept alongside first aid box or cupboard

subsection.content: In every quarry a stretcher shall at all times be kept alongside the first aid box or cupboard and maintained in good condition.
The proprietor of any quarry in respect of which paragraph (1) is contravened shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s25
section.heading: No work to be carried on except under sole supervision of supervisor or deputy supervisor

subsection.leadIn: Except as provided in paragraph (2), no work shall be carried on in any quarry unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an approved supervisor of the quarry is present at the quarry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the work is carried on under the sole supervision of such approved supervisor.

subsection.leadIn: Where no approved supervisor is present at the quarry, work may be carried on in the quarry if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an approved deputy supervisor of the quarry is present at the quarry; and

content.leadIn: the work is carried on under the sole supervision of such approved deputy supervisor:

subsection.proviso: Provided that the total time in any 1 year during which work may be carried on in a quarry in accordance with this paragraph shall not, except with the consent in writing of the Commissioner or any person authorized in writing by the Commissioner for Labour, exceed 500 hours.

subsection.content: The proprietor of any quarry in which any work is carried on in contravention of paragraph (1) or (2) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Supervisor on duty to complete daily entry in Time Register

subsection.content: Every supervisor on duty in a quarry shall in respect of each period during which work is carried on in the quarry under his supervision complete the prescribed entry in the Time Register. (See First Schedule, Form 4)
Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Persons not to work in quarry without sufficient instruction or training

subsection.content: No supervisor on duty in a quarry shall permit any person to work therein who has not received sufficient instruction and training in the work in which he is engaged.
Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Supervisor on duty to inspect working places periodically

subsection.content: At the beginning of every work shift in any quarry, every place or road therein which will be used by any person in the course of his work during the work shift shall be inspected by the supervisor on duty to determine whether any person who may use such place or road during the work shift will be endangered or is likely to be endangered.

subsection.leadIn: At the beginning of the first work shift on every day on which work is carried on in any quarry, the supervisor on duty shall inspect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every top, face or side in the quarry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any overburden in the quarry,

subsection.continued: to determine whether the top, face, side or overburden endangers or is likely to endanger any person at any place in the quarry.

subsection.content: Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) or (2) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Supervisor on duty to prohibit entry to dangerous place or road

subsection.leadIn: Where the supervisor on duty in a quarry—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on making any inspection under regulation 28(1) finds that any person who may use any place or road in the quarry during the working shift will be endangered or is likely to be endangered; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on making any inspection under regulation 28(2) finds that any top, face, side or overburden in a quarry endangers or is likely to endanger any person at any place in the quarry,

subsection.continued: he shall forthwith prohibit every person from entering or remaining on such place or road, or such place, as the case may be, until the danger or likelihood of danger is removed.

subsection.content: Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Inspection report

subsection.content: Every supervisor on duty in a quarry who makes an inspection under regulation 28(1) or (2) shall forthwith enter in the Quarry Inspection Register a full report of the result of his inspection including details of any prohibition made by him under regulation 29(1). (See First Schedule, Form 3)
Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Offence to enter dangerous place or road in contravention of prohibition
section.leadIn: Any person who enters or remains on any place or road, or any place, as the case may be, in a quarry in contravention of a prohibition made by the supervisor on duty under regulation 29(1) shall be guilty of an offence:
section.proviso: Provided that with the consent of the supervisor on duty a person may enter or remain on the place or road, or place, as the case may be, for the purposes of removing the danger or likelihood of danger.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Worker to carry out periodic inspections of working place

subsection.leadIn: Every person who works in a quarry shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the beginning of every work shift therein; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after any shot has been fired at or in the vicinity of the place at which he is working,

subsection.continued: inspect the place at which he is working to determine whether it is a safe working place.

subsection.leadIn: If he is not satisfied with the safety of his working place, he shall forthwith—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stop working there;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: leave the working place; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: report to the supervisor on duty that he is not satisfied with the safety of the working place.

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes paragraph (1) or (2) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Supervisor on duty to inspect working place reported to be unsafe

subsection.content: Every supervisor on duty in a quarry who receives a report under regulation 32(2)(c) shall forthwith inspect the working place referred to in the report to determine whether it is a safe working place.

Where, on making an inspection under paragraph (1), the supervisor on duty finds that a working place is unsafe, he shall forthwith prohibit every person from entering or remaining on such place until it has been made safe.
Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) or (2) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Inspection report

subsection.content: Every supervisor on duty in a quarry who makes an inspection under regulation 33(1) shall forthwith enter in the Quarry Inspection Register a full report of the result of his inspection including details of any prohibition made by him under regulation 33(2). (See First Schedule, Form 3)
Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Offence to enter unsafe place in contravention of prohibition
section.leadIn: Any person who enters or remains on any place in contravention of a prohibition made by a supervisor on duty under regulation 33(2) shall be guilty of an offence:
section.proviso: Provided that with the consent of the supervisor on duty, a person may enter or remain on the place for the purposes of making it safe.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Safety helmet to be worn for certain work

subsection.content: No person shall go or remain on any top, face or floor in a quarry unless he is wearing a safety helmet of a type approved by the Commissioner or any officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for Labour under regulation 17(1).

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: being the supervisor on duty in a quarry, permits any person to go or remain on any top, face or floor in the quarry in contravention of paragraph (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contravenes paragraph (1),

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Safety rope or harness to be worn for certain work

subsection.leadIn: No person shall go or remain on any top or face in a quarry unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he wears a safety harness of a type approved under regulation 18(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the safety harness is securely attached to a safety rope; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the free end of the safety rope is securely attached to an anchorage. (L.N. 208 of 1973)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: contravenes paragraph (1),

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Supervisor on duty to inspect equipment periodically

subsection.content: At the beginning of the first work shift on every day on which work is carried on in any quarry, the supervisor on duty shall inspect all mechanical equipment used in the quarry or which is in the quarry for the purpose of being used, to determine whether it is in safe and efficient working order and shall inspect every anchorage which is in the quarry for the purpose of being used to determine whether it is safe to be used. (L.N. 208 of 1973)

subsection.leadIn: At the beginning of the first work shift on the first working day of every week in which work is carried on in any quarry, the supervisor on duty shall inspect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every safety rope and every safety harness used in the quarry or which is in the quarry for the purpose of being used, to determine whether they are in safe and efficient working order; and (L.N. 208 of 1973)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every safety helmet used in the quarry or which is in the quarry for the purpose of being used, to determine whether it is in safe condition.

subsection.content: Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) or (2) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Supervisor on duty to prohibit use of unsafe or inefficient equipment

subsection.leadIn: Where the supervisor on duty in a quarry—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on making any inspection under regulation 38(1), finds that any mechanical equipment is not in safe and efficient working order or that any anchorage is not safe to be used;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on making any inspection under regulation 38(2)(a), finds that any safety rope or safety harness is not in safe and efficient working order; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: on making any inspection under regulation 38(2)(b), finds that any safety helmet is not in a safe condition,

subsection.continued: he shall forthwith prohibit every person from operating or driving such mechanical equipment or from using such anchorage, safety rope, safety harness or safety helmet in the quarry until it has been put into safe and efficient working order, or safe condition, or is safe to be used, as the case may be. (L.N. 208 of 1973)

subsection.content: Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Inspection report

subsection.content: Every supervisor on duty in a quarry who makes an inspection under regulation 38(1) or (2) shall forthwith enter in the Equipment Register a full report of the result of his inspection including details of any prohibition made by him under regulation 39(1). (See First Schedule, Form 2)
Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Offence to use unsafe or inefficient equipment in contravention of prohibition

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: operates or drives any mechanical equipment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: uses any anchorage, safety rope, safety harness or safety helmet,

section.continued: in a quarry in contravention of a prohibition made by the supervisor on duty under regulation 39(1) shall be guilty of an offence:
section.proviso: Provided that with the consent of the supervisor on duty a person may operate or drive the mechanical equipment or use the anchorage, safety rope, safety harness or safety helmet for the purposes of putting it into safe and efficient working order, or safe condition, or making it safe to be used, as the case may be. (L.N. 208 of 1973)

section.name: s42
section.heading: Offence to use mechanical equipment without permission of supervisor on duty

subsection.content: No person shall operate or drive any mechanical equipment in a quarry without the permission of the supervisor on duty.
Any person who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Inexperienced person not to use mechanical equipment

subsection.content: No supervisor on duty in a quarry shall permit any person who is not experienced in the operation of any mechanical equipment to operate or drive such equipment in the quarry.
Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Unlicensed person not to use certain vehicles in quarry

subsection.content: No supervisor on duty in a quarry shall permit any vehicle which by virtue of the Road Traffic Ordinance (Cap. 374) may not be operated or driven on a road except by a person who holds a valid licence to operate or drive vehicles of that class, to be operated or driven in the quarry by any person who does not hold such a licence.
Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Supervisor on duty not to permit mechanical equipment to be used at or near edges unless banksman present

subsection.content: No supervisor on duty in a quarry shall permit any person to operate or drive any mechanical equipment at or near the edge of any face, side, tip or embankment in the quarry unless a banksman is in attendance.
Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Mechanical equipment not to be used at or near edges unless banksman present

subsection.content: No person shall operate or drive any mechanical equipment at or near the edge of any face, side, tip or embankment in a quarry unless a banksman is in attendance.

Where in respect of any mechanical equipment the attendance of a banksman is required under paragraph (1), the operator or driver shall comply with every direction or signal which is given to him by the banksman.
Any person who contravenes paragraph (1) or (2) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Worker to report defect in equipment

subsection.content: Every operator or driver of any mechanical equipment in a quarry who becomes aware of any defect in such equipment shall forthwith stop operating or driving such equipment and report the defect to the supervisor on duty.

Every person who, while using any anchorage, safety rope, safety harness or safety helmet in any quarry in which any work is being carried on, becomes aware of any defect in that anchorage, safety rope, safety harness or safety helmet shall forthwith stop using it and report the defect to the supervisor on duty. (L.N. 208 of 1973)
Any person who contravenes paragraph (1) or (2) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Supervisor on duty to inspect reported defect in equipment

subsection.content: Every supervisor on duty in a quarry to whom a defect is reported under regulation 47(1) or (2) shall forthwith inspect the defect.

Where, on inspecting a reported defect under paragraph (1), the supervisor on duty finds that it is causing or is likely to cause danger to any person, he shall forthwith prohibit every person from operating or driving the mechanical equipment or using the anchorage, safety rope, safety harness or safety helmet, as the case may be, in the quarry until the defect has been remedied. (L.N. 208 of 1973)
Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) or (2) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Inspection report

subsection.content: Every supervisor on duty in a quarry who inspects a reported defect under regulation 48(1) shall forthwith enter in the Equipment Register a full report of the result of his inspection including details of any prohibition made by him under regulation 48(2). (See First Schedule, Form 2)
Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Offence to use defective equipment in contravention of prohibition

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: operates or drives any mechanical equipment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: uses any anchorage, safety rope, safety harness or safety helmet,

section.continued: in contravention of a prohibition made by a supervisor on duty under regulation 48(1) shall be guilty of an offence:
section.proviso: Provided that with the consent of the supervisor on duty a person may operate or drive the mechanical equipment or use the anchorage, safety rope, safety harness or safety helmet, as the case may be, for the purposes of remedying the defect.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Offence to go under certain mechanical equipment

subsection.leadIn: No person in a quarry shall go or remain underneath—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any object suspended by a lifting appliance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the arc of travel of a bucket of any mechanical loading equipment which is in operation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a loaded bucket of any mechanical loading equipment.

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Manner in which work is to be executed

subsection.leadIn: The supervisor on duty in a quarry shall cause all work therein to be carried out so as to avoid as far as may reasonably be possible—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any overhanging rock or overburden on any face or side in the quarry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any danger from any fall of rock or overburden.

subsection.content: Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Overburden to be cleared back

subsection.content: The supervisor on duty in a quarry shall cause all work therein to be carried out so that any overburden at the top of any face or side in the quarry is cleared back horizontally from the top of the face or side to a distance of not less than twice that of the height of the overburden or not less than 8 metres, whichever is the greater. (L.N. 238 of 1984)
Any supervisor on duty who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Maximum height of face

subsection.leadIn: Subject to regulation 55, where the height of any face in a quarry exceeds 25 metres, or such lesser height as the Commissioner or any officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for Labour may in any particular case specify under paragraph (2), no work on the face shall be carried on except for the purpose of reducing the height of the face to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a height of 25 metres; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where a height of less than 25 metres has been specified by the Commissioner or any officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for Labour under paragraph (2), that lesser height. (L.N. 238 of 1984)

subsection.content: If in the opinion of the Commissioner or any officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for Labour it is in any particular case desirable to do so for the purposes of safety in a quarry, he may by notice in writing, in English and in Chinese, served on the proprietor of the quarry specify a height, being a height less than 25 metres, in excess of which no work on a face in the quarry may be carried on otherwise than in accordance with paragraph (1)(b). (L.N. 238 of 1984)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: being the supervisor on duty in a quarry, permits any work on any face therein to be carried on in contravention of paragraph (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: works on any face in contravention of paragraph (1),

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Commissioner may permit work on face exceeding maximum height
section.content: The Commissioner or any officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for Labour may if he thinks fit in any particular case give permission in writing for work on any face in a quarry to be carried on notwithstanding that the height of the face exceeds 25 metres.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Work on faces not to be carried on simultaneously where danger of falling objects

subsection.content: Where any face in a quarry is situated above any other face therein so that there is a likelihood that, if work on the higher face is carried on, any person working on the lower face will be endangered by the fall of any substance or thing from the higher face, no work on the lower face shall be carried on simultaneously with any work on the higher face.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: being the supervisor on duty in a quarry, permits any work on any face therein to be carried on in contravention of paragraph (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: works on any face in contravention of paragraph (1),

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Accidents and dangerous occurrences

subsection.leadIn: Where any fatal accident or dangerous occurrence occurs at a quarry, no person shall, except for the purpose of saving life or assisting or rendering first aid to any injured person— (E.R. 4 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disturb the place at which the accident or occurrence took place; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remove or interfere with anything at that place,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the expiry of 3 clear days after the accident or occurrence has been notified to the Superintendent of Mines under regulation 17 or 18 of the Factories and Industrial Undertakings Regulations (Cap. 59 sub. leg. A); or (E.R. 4 of 2024)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the place at which the accident or occurrence took place has been visited by the Commissioner or any officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for Labour,

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes paragraph (1) shall be guilty of an offence.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Penalties

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: commits an offence under regulation 18 is liable on conviction to a fine of $400,000;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: commits an offence under regulation 19(2)(b), 27, 28, 32(3) (in relation to a requirement under regulation 32(1)), 36(2), 38, 42, 43, 44 or 47 is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: commits an offence under regulation 26, 30, 34, 40 or 49 is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: commits an offence under regulation 29, 31, 32(3) (in relation to a requirement under regulation 32(2)), 33, 35, 37(2), 39, 41, 45, 46, 48, 50, 51, 52, 53, 54(3) or 56(2) is liable on conviction to a fine of $150,000.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Liability of proprietor
section.content: Notwithstanding section 13(1) of the Ordinance, no proprietor of a quarry shall be guilty of an offence against any of these regulations unless it is expressly provided in such regulation that a proprietor of a quarry shall be guilty of an offence.

heading.inline: First Aid Equipment Required where the Number of Persons Employed or Engaged to Work in a Quarry does not Exceed 50

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: A copy of the leaflet issued by the Commissioner giving advice on first aid treatment.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: A sufficient number of (and in any event, not less than 12) small sterilized unmedicated dressings for injured fingers.

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: A sufficient number of (and in any event, not less than 6) medium-sized sterilized unmedicated dressings for injured hands or feet.

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: A sufficient number of (and in any event, not less than 4) adhesive wound dressings of assorted sizes.

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: A sufficient number of (and in any event, not less than 4) triangular bandages of unbleached calico, the longest side of each bandage measuring not less than 1.3 metres and each of the other sides of each bandage measuring not less than 900 millimetres.

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: A sufficient supply (and in any event, not less than 1 roll of 25 millimetres by 4.5 metres of zinc oxide plaster) of adhesive plaster.

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: A sufficient number of (and in any event, not less than 6) 30 grams packets of absorbent cotton wool.

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: A pressure bandage.

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: A sufficient number of safety pins.

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: An eye bath.
